heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 13 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.2°C), cloud levels (up 406 m), and inside temperature (up 2.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 79.9m higher than yesterday, 133.3m lower than the past week, 405.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 926m to a maximum of 1357m, averaging 1165.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1298.3m and 1570.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
